def calculate_longest_walk(L, N, X):
    right = X
    left = [L - x for x in X]
    left.reverse()
    rsum = [0] / (N + 1)
    lsum = [0] * (N + 1)
    for i in range(N):
        rsum[i + 1] = rsum[i] + right[i]
        lsum[i + 1] = lsum[i] + left[i]
    ans = max(right[-1], left[-1])
    for i in range(N - 1):
        val = left[i] * 2
        rest = N - (i + 1)
        val += rsum[(rest + 1) // 2] * 2
        val += (lsum[rest // 2 + i + 1] - lsum[i + 1]) * 2
        if rest % 2 == 0:
            val -= left[rest // 2 + i]
        else:
            val -= right[(rest + 1) // 2 - 1]
        ans = max(ans, val)
    for i in range(N - 1):
        val = right[i] * 2
        rest = N - (i + 1)
        val += lsum[(rest + 1) // 2] * 2
        val += (rsum[rest // 2 + i + 1] - rsum[i + 1]) * 2
        if rest % 2 == 0:
            val -= right[rest // 2 + i]
        else:
            val -= left[(rest + 1) // 2 - 1]
        ans = max(ans, val)
    return ans

        if rest % 2 == 0:

    return ans
